25:T2fcf,<entryFree id="n1206" key="أَمَرَهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (T, S, M, &amp;c.,) aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">اَمُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, (M, &amp;c.,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign> (T, S, M, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">إِمَارٌ</foreign>, (M, L, K,) which latter, however, is disapproved by MF, (TA,) and <foreign lang="ar">إِيمَارٌ</foreign> is syn. therewith, (K,) but this also is disapproved by MF, and deemed by him strange, [being by rule the inf. n. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1206-1" target="آمَرَهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, respecting which see what follows,] (TA,) and <foreign lang="ar">آمِرَةٌ</foreign>, (M, K,) which is one of the inf. ns. [or quasiinf. ns.] of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِلَةٌ</foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">عَافِيَةٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">عَاقِبَةٌ</foreign>, (M,) <hi rend="ital">He commanded him; ordered him; bade him; enjoined him;</hi> the inf. n. signifying the <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">نَهْىٌ</foreign>; (T, M, K;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1206-2" target="آمرهُ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (Kr, M, K,) mentioned by A'Obeyd also as a dial. var. of <foreign lang="ar">أمَرَهُ</foreign>: (Msb:) but A'Obeyd says that <foreign lang="ar">آمَرْتُهُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">أَمرْتُهُ</foreign> are syn. [in a sense different from that explained above, i. e.] as meaning <foreign lang="ar">كَثَّرْتُهُ</foreign>. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ بِهِ</foreign>, (S, M, K,) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ إِيَّاهُ</foreign>, suppressing the prep., (M,) <hi rend="ital">He commanded, ordered, bade,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoined, him to do it.</hi> (M, K.) And <foreign lang="ar">أمَرْتُكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">لِتَفْعَلَ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">بِأنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">I commanded, ordered, bade,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoined, thee to do</hi> [such a thing]. (M.) [And <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ بِكَذَا</foreign> as meaning <hi rend="ital">He commanded him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ordered him, to make use of such a thing; or the like:</hi> whence, in a trad.,] <foreign lang="ar">أُمِرْتُ بِالسِّوَاكِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I have been commanded to make use of the tooth-stick</hi>]. (El-Jámi' es- Sagheer.) [And <hi rend="ital">He enjoined him such a thing;</hi> as, for instance, patience.] The imperative of <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ</foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">مُرْ</foreign>; originally <foreign lang="ar">اؤْمُرْ</foreign>; which also occurs [with <foreign lang="ar">وَ</foreign> in the place of <foreign lang="ar">ؤ</foreign> when the <foreign lang="ar">ا</foreign> is pronounced with damm]: (M:) but [generally] when it is not preceded by a conjunction, (Msb,) i. e., by <foreign lang="ar">وَ</foreign> or <foreign lang="ar">فَ</foreign>, (T,) you suppress the <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, [i. e. the radical <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, and with it the conjunctive <foreign lang="ar">ا</foreign> preceding it,] contr. to rule, and say, <foreign lang="ar">مُرْهُ بِكَذَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Command,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">order,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bid,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoin, thou him to do such a thing</hi>]; like as you say, <foreign lang="ar">كُلْ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">خُذْ</foreign>: when, however, it is preceded by a conjunction, the practice commonly obtaining is, to restore the <foreign lang="ar">وَأْمُرْ بِكَذَا</foreign>, agreeably with analogy, and thus to say, <foreign lang="ar">أَمُرْ بِكَذَا</foreign>. (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [You say also, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ بِهِ فَقُتِلَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He gave an order respecting him, and accordingly he was slain.</hi> And <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ لَهُ بِكَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He ordered that such a thing should be done, or given, to him</hi>.]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  In the Kur [xvii. 17], <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرْنَا مُتْرَفِيهَا فَفَسَقُوا فِيهَا</foreign>, so accord. to most of the readers, (T, &amp;c.,) means <hi rend="ital">We commanded</hi> [<hi rend="ital">its luxurious inhabitants</hi>] to obey, <hi rend="ital">but they transgressed therein,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">departed from the right way,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disobeyed:</hi> (Fr, T, S, &amp;c.:) so says Aboo-Is-hák; adding that, although one says, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرتُ زَيْدًا فَضَرَبَ عَمْرًا</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">I commanded Zeyd to beat 'Amr, and he beat him,</hi> yet one also says, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرْتُكَ فَعَصَيْتَنِى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I commanded thee, but thou disobeyedst me</hi>]: or, accord. to some, the meaning is, <hi rend="ital">We multiplied its luxurious inhabitants;</hi> (T;) and this is agreeable with another reading, namely,   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1206-3" target="آمَرْنَا" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; (TA;) and a reading of El-Hasan, namely, <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرْنَا</foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">عَلِمْنَا</foreign>, may be a dial. var., of the same signification: (M:) see 4, in two places: or it may be from <foreign lang="ar">الإِمَارَةُ</foreign>; (S, TA;) [in which case it seems that we should read   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1206-4" target="أَمَّرْنَا" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; or, perhaps, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرْنَا</foreign>: see 2:] Abu-l-'Áliyeh reads   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1206-5" target="أَمَّرْنَا" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, and this is agreeable with the explanation of I'Ab, who says that the meaning is, <hi rend="ital">We made its chiefs to have authority, power,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dominion.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">اَمُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, also signifies <hi rend="ital">He commanded, ordered, bade,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoined, him to do that which it behooved him to do.</hi> (A.) [<hi rend="ital">He counselled,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advised, him</hi>.] One says, <foreign lang="ar">مُرْنِى</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">Counsel thou me; advise thou me.</hi> (A.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ بِاقْتِنَاصٍ</foreign>, said <pb n="96"/> of a wild animal, means <hi rend="ital">He rendered</hi> the beholder <hi rend="ital">desirous of capturing</hi> him. (M.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ</foreign>, (As, Fr, Th, T, S, M, Msb, K,) aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">اَمُرَ</orth>
                  </form>; (Msb, TA;) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمُرَ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">اَمُرَ</orth>
                  </form>; (S, M, IKtt, K;) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرَ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Ba" lang="ar">اَمَرَ</orth>
                  </form>; (M, K, and several other authorities; but by some this is disallowed; TA;) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign> (K) and <foreign lang="ar">إِمْرَةٌ</foreign> (S) and <foreign lang="ar">إِمَارَةٌ</foreign>; (As, T, S;) or the second is a simple subst.; (K;) or perhaps it is meant in the S that this and the third are quasi-inf. ns.; (MF;) <hi rend="ital">He had,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held, command; he presided as a commander, governor, lord, prince,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">king;</hi> (M, Msb, K;) <hi rend="ital">he became an</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَمِير</foreign>; (As, T, S;) <foreign lang="ar">عَلَى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">القَوْمِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">over the people.</hi> (M, * Msb, K.) [See also 5.] <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ فُلَانٌ وَأُمِرَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign>, or <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1206-6" target="وأُمِّرَ" n="6" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>عليه</foreign>, (as in different copies of the S,) [<hi rend="ital">Such a one has held command and been commanded,</hi>] is said of one who has been a commander, or governor, after having been a subject of a commander, or governor; meaning <hi rend="ital">such a one is a person of experience;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one who has been tried,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proved and strengthened, by experience.</hi> (S.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ</foreign> as syn. with <foreign lang="ar">آمَرَهُ</foreign>: see 4.       <sense type="A" n="4">-A4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرَ</foreign>, (S, M, Msb, K,) aor.      
    <form n="infl">

                  </form>, (Msb, K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرَة</foreign>; (M, K, TA; the latter written in the CK <foreign lang="ar">اَمْرَة</foreign>;) and <foreign lang="ar">أمُرَ</foreign>, aor.

                  </form>; (IKtt;) <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">It</hi> (a thing, M, Msb, or a man's property, or camels or the like, Abu-l-Hasan and S, and a people, T, S) <hi rend="ital">multiplied;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became many,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abundant;</hi> (T, S, M, Msb, K;) and <hi rend="ital">became complete.</hi> (M, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And the former, <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">His beasts multiplied;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became many;</hi> (M, K;) [as also

                  <form>       
                     <itype>8</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">ائتمر</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [written with the disjunctive alif <foreign lang="ar">اِيتَمَرَ</foreign>] <hi rend="ital">He obeyed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conformed to, a command;</hi> (S, * M, Mgh, K; *) <hi rend="ital">he heard and obeyed.</hi> (Msb.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">ائتمر بِخَيْرٍ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">He was as though his mind commanded him to do good and he obeyed the command.</hi> (M.) And [you use it transitively, saying,] <foreign lang="ar">ائتمر الأَمْرَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He obeyed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conformed to, the command.</hi> (S.) And <foreign lang="ar">لَا يَأْتَمِرُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رُشْدًا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He will not do right of his own accord.</hi> (A.) Imra el-Keys says, (S,) or En-Nemir Ibn-Towlab, (T,) <quote>
                     <L> 
                        <foreign lang="ar">وَيَعْدُو عَلَى المَرْءِ مَا يَأْتَمِرْ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">And that which man obeys wrongs him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">injures him</hi>]; meaning, that which his own soul commands him to do, and which he judges to be right, but in which often is found his destruction: (S:) or, accord. to Kt, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> evil <hi rend="ital">which man purposes to do:</hi> (T:) or <hi rend="ital">that which man does without consideration, and without looking to its result.</hi> (A 'Obeyd, T.) [See what follows.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">He undertook a thing without consulting;</hi> (Kt, T;) as though his soul, or mind, ordered him to do it and he obeyed it: (TA:) <hi rend="ital">he followed his own opinion only.</hi> (Mgh.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرْتُهُ فأْتَمَرَ وَأَبَى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَنْ يَأْتَمِرَ</foreign>, (A, Mgh,) meaning <hi rend="ital">I commanded him, but he followed his own opinion only, and refused to obey.</hi> (Mgh.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">He formed an opinion, and consulted his own mind, and determined upon it.</hi> (Sh, T.) And <foreign lang="ar">ائتمر رَأْيَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He consulted his own mind,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judgment,</hi> respecting what was right for him to do. (Sh, T.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ائتمروا</foreign>, (A, Msb,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">ائْتِمَارٌ</foreign>; (S, K;) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1211-1" target="تآمروا" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (A,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَآمُرٌ</foreign>, of the measure <foreign lang="ar">تَفَاعُلٌ</foreign>; (S;) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1211-2" target="تأمّروا" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَأَمُّرٌ</foreign>; (K;) <hi rend="ital">They consulted together:</hi> (S, * A, Msb, K: *) or <foreign lang="ar">ائتمروا</foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1211-3" target="تآمروا" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> signify <hi rend="ital">they commanded, ordered, bade,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoined, one another;</hi> like as one says, <foreign lang="ar">اقتتلوا</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">تقاتلوا</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">اختصموا</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">تخاصموا</foreign>: (T:) or <foreign lang="ar">ائتمروا عَلَى الأَمْرِ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1211-4" target="تآمروا" n="4" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>عَلَيْهِ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">they determined,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settled, their opinions respecting the affair,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">case:</hi> (M:) and <foreign lang="ar">ائتمروا بِهِ</foreign>, (S, Msb,) inf. n. as above, (K,) signifies <hi rend="ital">they purposed it,</hi> (S, Msb, K, *) namely, a thing, (Msb, K,) <hi rend="ital">and consulted one another respecting it.</hi> (S.) It is said in the Kur [lxv. 6], <foreign lang="ar">وَأْتَمِرُوا بَيْنَكُمْ بِمَعْرُوفٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">And command ye,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoin ye, one another to do good:</hi> [such is app. the meaning,] but God best knoweth: (T:) or, accord. to Kt, <hi rend="ital">purpose ye among yourselves to do good.</hi> (TA.) And in the same [xxviii. 19], <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّ الْمَلَأَ يَأْتَمِرُونَ بِكَ لِيَقْتُلوُكَ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">Verily the chiefs command one another respecting thee, to slay thee:</hi> (Zj, T:) or <hi rend="ital">consult together against thee, to slay thee:</hi> (AO, T:) or <hi rend="ital">purpose against thee, to slay thee:</hi> (Kt, T:) but the last but one of these explanations is better than the last. (T.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  See also 3.          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  Accord. to El-Bushtee, <foreign lang="ar">ائتمرهُ</foreign> also signifies <hi rend="ital">He gave him permission:</hi> but this has not been heard from an Arab. (Az, TA.)    </entryFree>2a:T1918,<entryFree id="n1212" key="أَمْرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A command; an order; a bidding; an injunction; a decree; an ordinance; a prescript:</hi> (S, * Msb, * TA, &amp;c.:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">أَوَامِرُ</foreign>: (S, Msb, &amp;c.:) so accord. to common usage; and some writers of authority justify and explain it by saying that <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign> is [originally] <foreign lang="ar">مَأْمُوُرٌ بِهِ</foreign>; that it is then changed to the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِلٌ</foreign>; [i. e., to <foreign lang="ar">آمِرٌ</foreign>;] like <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ عَارِفٌ</foreign>, which is originally <foreign lang="ar">مَعْرُوفٌ</foreign>; and <foreign lang="ar">عِيشَةٌ راضِيَةٌ</foreign>, originally <foreign lang="ar">مَرْضِيَّةٌ</foreign>; &amp;c.; [and then, to <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign>;] and that <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِلٌ</foreign> becomes in the pl. <foreign lang="ar">فَوَاعِلُ</foreign>; so that <foreign lang="ar">أَوَامَرُ</foreign> is the pl. of <foreign lang="ar">مَإْمُورٌ</foreign>: others say that it has this form of pl. to distinguish it from <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign> in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">حَالٌ</foreign> [&amp;c.], in which sense it has for its pl. <foreign lang="ar">أُمُورٌ</foreign>. (Msb, TA.) [But I think that <foreign lang="ar">أَوَامِرُ</foreign> may be properly and originally pl. of <foreign lang="ar">آمِرَةٌ</foreign>, for <foreign lang="ar">آيَةٌ آمِرَةٌ</foreign>, or the like. MF says that, accord. to the T and M, the pl. of <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign> in the sense explained in the beginning of this paragraph is <foreign lang="ar">أُمُورٌ</foreign>: but he seems to have founded his assertion upon corrupted copies of those works; for in the M, I find nothing on this point; and in the T, not, as he says, <foreign lang="ar">الأَمْرُضِدُّ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">النَّهْىَ وَاحِدُ الأُمُور</foreign>, but <foreign lang="ar">قَالَ اللَّيْثُ الأَمْرُ مَعْرُوفٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">نَقِيضُ النَّهْىِ وَاحِدُ الأُمُورِ</foreign>, evidently meaning that <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ</foreign> signifies the contr. of <foreign lang="ar">نَهْىٌ</foreign>, and is also, in another sense, the sing. of <foreign lang="ar">أُمُورٌ</foreign>.] [Hence,] <foreign lang="ar">أُولُو</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الأَمْرِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Those who hold command</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rule,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">the learned men.</hi> (M, K. [See Kur iv. 62.]) And <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرُاللّٰهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The threatened punishment of God:</hi> so in the Kur x. 25, and xi. 42, and xvi.1; in which last place occur the words, <foreign lang="ar">أَتَي أَمْرُ اللّٰهِ فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُوهُ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">The threatened punishment ordained of God hath, as it were, come:</hi> so near is it, that it is as though it had already come: <hi rend="ital">therefore desire not ye to hasten it.</hi> (Zj, M, TA.) And <hi rend="ital">The purpose of God.</hi> (Bd and Jel in lxv. 3; &amp;c.) And <foreign lang="ar">الأَمْرُ قَرِيبٌ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The resurrection,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the time thereof, is near.</hi> (Mgh, from a trad.) And <foreign lang="ar">مَا فَعَلْتُهُ عَنْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرِى</foreign>, in the Kur xviii. 81, <hi rend="ital">I did it not of my own judgment:</hi> (Bd:) or, <hi rend="ital">of my own choice.</hi> (Jel.) [Hence also <foreign lang="ar">الأَمْرُ</foreign>, in grammar, signifies <hi rend="ital">The imperative form</hi> of a verb.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">A thing; an affair; a business; a matter; a concern: a state, of a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of persons</hi> or <hi rend="ital">things</hi> 
                  <pb n="97"/> or <hi rend="ital">affairs or circumstances; a condition; a case: an accident; an event: an action:</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">شَأْنٌ</foreign>: (M, F, TA:) and <foreign lang="ar">حَالٌ</foreign>, (Msb, TA,) and <foreign lang="ar">حَالَةٌ</foreign>: (Msb:) and <foreign lang="ar">حَادِثَةٌ</foreign>: (K:) and <foreign lang="ar">فِعْلٌ</foreign>: (MF, TA:) and <hi rend="ital">a thing that is said; a saying:</hi> (TA voce <foreign lang="ar">أُولُو</foreign>, at the end of art. <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign>:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">أُمُورٌ</foreign>; (S, M, K, &amp;c.;) its only pl. in the senses here explained. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرُ فُلَانٍ مُسْتَقِيمٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The affair,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the like, of such a one is in a right state</hi>]: and <foreign lang="ar">امُورُهُ مُسْتَقِيمَةٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">His affairs are in a right state</hi>]. (S, A.) And <foreign lang="ar">شَتَّتَ أَمْرَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He dissipated, disorganized, disordered, unsettled,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">broke up, his state of things,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affairs.</hi> (As, TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">شعب</foreign>.) [<foreign lang="ar">امر</foreign> seems to be here used, as in many other instances, rather in the sense of the pl. than in that of the sing.]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمْرٌ كُلِّىٌّ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">A universal,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">general, prescript, rule,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">canon</hi>]. (Msb voce <foreign lang="ar">قَاعِدَةٌ</foreign>, KT voce <foreign lang="ar">قَانُونٌ</foreign>, &amp;c.)    </entryFree>2b:T970,<entryFree id="n1213" key="إِمْرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">إِمْرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">أمار</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">أمر</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">امر</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">مار</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">مر</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">آمر</orth>
                  </form> a subst. from <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرَالِأَمْرُ</foreign> in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">اِشْتَدَّ</foreign>; (S;) or a subst. from <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرَ</foreign> as signifying <foreign lang="ar">كَثُرَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">تَمَّ</foreign>; (M;) <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  [<hi rend="ital">A severe, a distressful, a grievous,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an afflictive, thing:</hi> or] <hi rend="ital">a terrible, and foul,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">very foul, thing:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a wonderful thing.</hi> (TA,) Hence, [used as an epithet, like <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرٌ</foreign>, q. v.,] in the Kur [xviii. 70], <foreign lang="ar">لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْئًا إِمْرًا</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">Verily thou hast done a severe, a distressful, a grievous,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an afflictive, thing:</hi> (S:) or <hi rend="ital">a terrible, and foul,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">very foul, thing:</hi> (TA:) or <hi rend="ital">a wonderful thing:</hi> (S:) or <hi rend="ital">an abominable, a foul,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an evil, and a wonderful, thing:</hi> (Ks, M, K: *) or <hi rend="ital">a terrible and an abominable thing;</hi> signifying more than <foreign lang="ar">نَكْرًا</foreign>, [which occurs after, in verse 73,] inasmuch as the [presumed] drowning of the persons in the ship was more abominable than the slaying of one person: (Zj, T:) or <hi rend="ital">a crafty, and an abominable,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a foul,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an evil, and a wonderful, thing;</hi> and derived from <foreign lang="ar">أَمِرَ القَوْمُ</foreign> as meaning <foreign lang="ar">كَثُرُوا</foreign>.       <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1231-1" target="مُؤْتَمِرٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1242"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Two days,</hi> (S,) <hi rend="ital">the last,</hi> (K,) <hi rend="ital">the former being the sixth, and the latter the seventh,</hi> (M,) <hi rend="ital">of the days called</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَيَّامُ الَجُوزِ</foreign>: (S, M, K: [but see <foreign lang="ar">عَجُوزٌ</foreign>:]) as though the former commanded men to be cautious, and the latter consulted them as to whether they should set forth on a journey or stay at home: (S:) accord. to Az, the latter is applied as an epithet to the day as meaning <foreign lang="ar">يُؤْتَمَرُفِيهِ</foreign>. (TA.)    </entryFree>34:T2f3d,<entryFree id="n1234" key="تَأْمُورٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">تَأْمُورٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-1" target="تَأْمُورَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1236"/></foreign> are properly mentioned in this art.; the measure of the former being <foreign lang="ar">تَفْعُولٌ</foreign>; (K;) and that of the latter, <foreign lang="ar">تَفْعْلولَةٌ</foreign>: (TA:) not as J has imagined; [who writes them without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, and mentions them in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>;] (K;) their measures accord. to him being <foreign lang="ar">فَاعُولٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">فَاعُولَةٌ</foreign>. (TA.) [But in all the senses here explained, they appear to be with and without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  The former signifies The <hi rend="ital">soul:</hi> (S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, where it is written without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>; and M, A, K:) because it is that which is wont to command. (A.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">قَدْ عَلِمَ تَأْمُورُكَ ذلِكَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Thy soul,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">self, hath known that.</hi> (AZ, and T in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">intellect:</hi> (M:) as in the saying, <foreign lang="ar">عَرَفْتُهُ بِتَأْمُورِي</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I knew it by my intellect.</hi> (M in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>; and TA.) You say also, <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ ابْنُ تَأْمُورِهَا</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">He is the knowing with respect to it.</hi> (TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">بني</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">heart,</hi> (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign> without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, and M, A, K,) <hi rend="ital">itself.</hi> (M, TA.) Hence the saying, <foreign lang="ar">حَرْفٌ فِى تَأْمُورِى خَيْرٌ مِنْ عَشَرَةٍ فى وِ عَائِكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">One word in my heart is better than ten in thy receptacle</hi>]. (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, and TA.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">pericardium.</hi> (M in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">core,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">black</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inner part,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clot of blood,</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">حَبَّة</foreign>, M, K, or <foreign lang="ar">عَلَقَة</foreign>, TA,) and <hi rend="ital">life,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">blood, of the heart:</hi> (M, K:) or <hi rend="ital">blood,</hi> (As, S, M, in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, and K,) absolutely: (TA:) and <foreign lang="ar">تَأْمُورُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">النَّفْسِ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">the life-blood:</hi> (As, S:) or <hi rend="ital">the blood of the body:</hi> (S in art. <foreign lang="ar">نفس</foreign>:) and <hi rend="ital">the life of the soul.</hi> (M, K.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  Also, as being likened to blood, (TA,) <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Wine;</hi> and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-2" target="تَأْمُورَةٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1236"/></foreign>: (M, K:) and          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">A dye:</hi> (M, TA:) and          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Saffron.</hi> (As, K.)          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  [Hence also,] <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Water.</hi> (M, K.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">مَا فىِ الرَّكِيَّةِ تَامُورٌ</foreign>, (T, S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, and M,) or <foreign lang="ar">تَأْمُورٌ</foreign>, (A,) <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">There is not in the well any water.</hi> (T, S, M, A.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">wezeer</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">وَزِير</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">of a king:</hi> (M, K:) because his command is effectual. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Any one:</hi> as in the saying, <foreign lang="ar">مَابِهَا تَأْمُورٌ</foreign>, (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, A, K,) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-3" target="تُؤْمُورٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1235"/></foreign>, (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, and K,) each with an augmentative <foreign lang="ar">ت</foreign>, and without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign> as well as with it, accord. to Er-Radee and others, (TA,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-4" target="تَأْمُرِىُّ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1232"/></foreign>, and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-5" target="تَأْمُورِىُّ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (M,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-6" target="تُؤْمُرِىُّ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, M, TA,) or without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, (S, M, K, in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-7" target="أَمَرٌ" n="7" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1214"/></foreign>, (M, K,) <hi rend="ital">There is not in it</hi> (i. e. in the house, <foreign lang="ar">الدار</foreign>, M, A, TA) <hi rend="ital">any one.</hi> (M, A, K, and T and S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>.) You say also, <foreign lang="ar">بِلَادٌ خَلَآءٌ لَيْسَ فِيهَا <ref cref="n1234-8" target="تُومُرِىٌّ" n="8" type="4" subtype="FTLSO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Vacant regions wherein is not any one.</hi> (S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>.)   
      <anchor/><foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-9" target="تُؤْمُرِىٌّ" n="9" type="2" subtype="FPO" lang="ar" select="n1233"/></foreign> (M, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-10" target="تُومُرِىٌّ" n="10" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-11" target="تَأْمُورِىٌّ" n="11" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1237"/></foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-12" target="تَأْمُرِيٌّ" n="12" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (M, K) also signify <hi rend="ital">A man,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">human being.</hi> (S, * M, K.) You say, speaking of a beautiful woman, <foreign lang="ar">مَا رَأَيْتُ <ref cref="n1234-13" target="تُومُرِيَّا" n="13" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>أَحْسَنَ مِنْهَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I have not seen a human being,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">creature, more beautiful than she:</hi> (S and M in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>:) and <foreign lang="ar">مَا رَأَيْتُ  <ref cref="n1234-14" target="تُومُرِيَّا" n="14" type="6" subtype="FTFSO" lang="ar"/> أَحْسَنَ مِنْهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I have not seen a man more beautiful than he</hi>]. (T and S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>.) Accord. to some, they are used only in negative phrases; but accord. to others, they are also used in such as are affirmative. (MF.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">Anything:</hi> as in the saying <foreign lang="ar">أَكَلَ الذِّئْبُ الشَّاةَ فَمَا تَرَكَ مِنْهَا تَامُورًا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The wolf ate the sheep,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goat, and left not of it anything</hi>]. (T and S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>.)       <sense type="A" n="4">-A4-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A child, young one,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fœtus</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">وَلَدٌ</foreign>. (M, K.)       <sense type="A" n="5">-A5-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">receptacle</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">وِعَآء</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">of the child, young one,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fœtus.</hi> (M in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>; and K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">وِعَآء</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">in the ordinary sense;</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">a bag,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receptacle, for travelling-provisions and for goods or utensils &amp;c.</hi>]. (M, K.) Hence the saying, <foreign lang="ar">أَنْتَ أَعْلَمُ بِتَأْمُورِكَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Thou art best acquainted with what thou hast with thee;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">with thine own mind.</hi> (M.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  Also, (K,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-15" target="تَأْمُورَةٌ" n="15" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1236"/></foreign>, (M, [in which the former is not given in the following senses,] and K,) or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1234-16" target="تَامُورَةٌ" n="16" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>,) <hi rend="ital">A ewer,</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">إِبْرِيقٌ</foreign>, (S, M, K,) <hi rend="ital">for wine:</hi> (S:) and, (M, K,) or, as some say, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّة</foreign> (M, K, TA) <hi rend="ital">in which wine is put.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Also the first, (M, K,) or ↓ third, (T and S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>,) The <hi rend="ital">chamber,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cell,</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">صَوْمَعَة</foreign>, T and M in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>, without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, and S and K, and <foreign lang="ar">نامُوى</foreign>, M, K,) <hi rend="ital">of a monk.</hi> (M, K.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  And hence, (TA,) the first, (K,) and ↓ second, (M, K,) or ↓ third, of these three words, (T and S, in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>,) <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  The <hi rend="ital">covert,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">retreat, of a lion.</hi> (T, S, M, K.) Whence,   
      <foreign lang="ar">فُلَانٌ أَسَدٌ فِى <ref cref="n1234-17" target="تَامُورَتِهِ" n="17" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Such a one is a lion in his covert:</hi> (T and S in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign>:) a saying borrowed from 'Amr Ibn-Maadee-Kerib: (T and S ibid:) or, accord. to some, it means, <hi rend="ital">a lion in the greatness of his courage,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">in his heart.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="6">-A6-</sense>  Also (i. e. the first only) <hi rend="ital">Play,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sport, of girls</hi> or <hi rend="ital"> of boys.</hi> (Th, M in art. <foreign lang="ar">تمر</foreign> without <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign>, and K.)       <sense type="A" n="7">-A7-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">يَأْمُورٌ</foreign>.    </entryFree>35:T57c,<entryFree id="n1239" key="مُؤَمَّرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مُؤَمَّرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Made,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appointed, commander, governor, lord, prince,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">king:</hi> (S, M, K: *) <hi rend="ital">made to have authority, power,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dominion:</hi> (T, M, K:) in which latter sense it is explained by Khálid, as applied by Ibn-Mukbil to a spear. (T.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  A cane, or spear-shaft, <hi rend="ital">having a spearhead affixed to it.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  A spear-head (T, TA) <hi rend="ital">sharpened;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">مُحَدَّدٌ</foreign>. (T, M, K, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Distinguished,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defined,</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">مُحَدَّدٌ</foreign>,) <hi rend="ital">by signs,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">marks:</hi> (TA:) or, as some say, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">marked with a hot iron;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">مُوْسُومٌ</foreign>. (K, TA.)    </entryFree>36:T699,<entryFree id="n1240" key="مَأْمُورٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مَأْمُورٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [pass. part. n. of <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَهُ</foreign>, q. v.].          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  It is said in a trad., (S, &amp;c.,) <foreign lang="ar">خَيْرُ المَالِ مُهْرَةٌ مَأْمُورَةٌ وَسِكَّةٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مَأْبُورَةٌ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">The best of property are a prolific filly</hi> [<hi rend="ital">and a row of palm-trees,</hi> or perhaps <hi rend="ital">a tall palmtree, fecundated</hi>]; (AZ, A 'Obeyd, T, S, A, K;) as though the filly were commanded [by God] to be so: (A, in which the epithet <foreign lang="ar">مأمورة</foreign> thus used is said to be tropical:) [or] <foreign lang="ar">مأمورة</foreign> is thus for the sake of conformity to <foreign lang="ar">مأبورة</foreign>, and is originally <foreign lang="ar">مُؤْمَرَةٌ</foreign>, (S, M, * K,) from <foreign lang="ar">آمَرَهَا اللّٰهُ</foreign>: (TA:) or it is a dial. var. of weak authority; (K;) though, accord. to AZ, it signifies <hi rend="ital">made to have abundant offspring,</hi> from <foreign lang="ar">أَمَرَ اللّٰهُ المُهْرَةَ</foreign>, meaning “God made the filly to have abundant offspring,” a dial. var. of <foreign lang="ar">آمَرَهَا</foreign>, as A 'Obeyd also asserts it to be. (TA.)    </entryFree>37:T57b,<entryFree id="n1242" key="مُؤْتَمِرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مُؤْتَمِرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [<hi rend="ital">Obeying,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conforming to, a command;</hi> &amp;c.: see 8.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense> ] One <hi rend="ital">who acts according to his own opinion;</hi> (T;) <hi rend="ital">who follows his own opinion</hi> 
                  <pb n="99"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">only:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">who hastes to speak.</hi> (M.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">آمِرٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also, and <foreign lang="ar">المُؤْتَمِرُ</foreign>, [<hi rend="ital">The month which is now commonly called</hi>] <foreign lang="ar">المُحَرَّمُ</foreign>: (M, K:) the former appellation (<foreign lang="ar">مؤتمر</foreign>) is that by which the tribe of 'Ád called it: (Ibn-El-Kelbee:) pl.
